page.title: 18EVENTS IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: dress and dog races. In 1984 the first prize for each race was Â£1, second prize 50p and third 25p. There is also Gala Day which includes a pram race where all the competitors wear fancy dress. They set off from the dock and finish at the Fylingdales Inn. The winner receives a cup. The children take part in a sandcastle competition which is held below the sea wall where there is most sand. Coins are placed in a line down Bay Bank at the side of the road. The money donated is for the Parish Hall. In the Autumn Fylingthorpe and Robin Hoods Bay have bonfires, one at Thorpe above the park and one at Bay below the sea wall. Soup and other refreshments are provided and the fireworks are supervised by the local firemen.
